alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 5:48AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...A WINTRY MIX OF SNOW, FREEZING RAIN, AND RAIN LIKELY THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... A frontal system will bring snow to areas of the eastern Kenai Peninsula along the Seward Highway this morning, with several inches of snow possible along the highway from Portage Valley to Turnagain Pass. Warmer air aloft will move overhead throughout the day today, allowing for snow levels to climb to between 800 and 1200 ft by Saturday afternoon. The warmer air will allow snow to changeover to rain, first for Seward and Whittier, then for Portage Valley and portions of the Seward Highway that typically experience warmer temperatures. Snow or mixed rain/snow is expected to linger from Summit Lake to Turnagain Pass through Saturday evening. A brief period of freezing rain is possible through Portage Valley late Saturday morning or early Saturday afternoon as the warmer air arrives, but prior to the development of southeasterly surface winds. Once these winds increase, warmer air at the surface should allow for a transition to all rain. Rain on top of cold roadway surfaces may lead to icy conditions and hazardous travel conditions. Rain may also lead to water ponding on area roadways. Motorists are urged to slow down and use caution when traveling. For the latest forecast visit www.weather.gov/afc. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
